patterns: Tell me about the IS department
What is the School of Information Systems?
Where is the IS department located?
What is taught in IS at AAU?
responses:
👋 Hello! Welcome to the Addis Ababa University School of Information Systems! 😊

The School of Information Systems, part of the College of Natural Sciences, offers a vibrant 4-year Bachelor of Information Systems (BIS) program. We're located on the FBE Campus, offering a blend of technical and managerial skills training.

📚 *Curriculum Highlights*: Our BIS program covers a wide range of topics, from programming (C++, Java, web development) and databases to system analysis, design, and cybersecurity. You can find detailed course info including credit hours in our course catalog (available on request).

👨‍🏫 *Faculty*: We have a dedicated team of instructors. You can find their office locations, emails, and LinkedIn profiles in our Instructor Directory.

🎉 *Events & Community*: We host regular events like hackathons, IS Day, workshops, game fests, and IS Talks—perfect for networking, learning, and fun!

🏢 *Location & Contact*: The department office is on the 1st floor of the Eshetu Chole Building, FBE Campus. Phone: 011 122 9191.

Feel free to ask anything else! 😊

patterns: What do you know about IS students?
Do you know any IS students?
responses: The best people, the best doctors, the best sisters. Nobody is like them!

patterns: How are the students in IS?
responses:
Information Systems (IS) students at Addis Ababa University are known for their interdisciplinary skills, blending tech with business insight. 💡 Many are talented in coding, design, and data analysis, while also excelling in project management and communication. 

They actively participate in community events like hackathons, workshops, IS Day, and IS Talks 🎉. They're also involved in clubs like GDSC AAU and contribute to real-world projects, startups, and competitions. 

IS students come from diverse backgrounds but share a common passion for solving problems using technology and information systems. They're creative, collaborative, and constantly pushing boundaries! 🚀

patterns: What do you know about Docye?
responses: The best person, the best Doctor, the best sister. Nobody is like her!

patterns: What makes the IS department special?
Why is the Information Systems program unique?
Tell me the best features of the IS program
Why should I study IS at AAU?
Special aspects of Information Systems department
responses: 📍 The Information Systems (IS) program at Addis Ababa University stands out for its powerful integration of both technical and managerial skills. Unlike purely technical Computer Science programs, our BIS curriculum blends business principles, management theories, and socio-cultural insights with programming and IT infrastructure training. 🖥️📊 This holistic education prepares students to be system designers, analysts, project managers, and tech-savvy entrepreneurs ready for multidisciplinary careers.

patterns: Why are IS students at AAU special?
Describe the uniqueness of IS students
How do IS students stand out?
responses:
💡 IS students at AAU are uniquely equipped with both technical and managerial expertise. Through programming, database systems, and networking courses, they gain strong technical foundations. But they also take classes in Entrepreneurship, Management, and Accounting, building essential business skills. 

Their experiences go beyond the classroom with hands-on activities like hackathons, IS Talks, and collaborative projects. The focus on emerging technologies like AI and IoT, paired with ethics and societal relevance, makes them versatile innovators ready for the future.

patterns: Can I get a summary of IS courses?
What are the IS courses like?
Tell me about the IS program structure
Give me a course overview for Information Systems
responses:
🗂️ The Bachelor of Information Systems (BIS) program at AAU is a comprehensive 4-year journey:

📘 **1st Year:** Core courses like Communicative English, Programming in C++, Applied Math, and Emerging Technologies.

📗 **2nd Year:** Students dive deeper into Management, Discrete Math, Accounting, Object-Oriented Programming, and Databases.

📙 **3rd Year:** Includes Internet Programming, Research Methods, System Analysis & Design, and Networking.

📕 **4th Year:** Advanced topics such as AI, HCI, Project Management, Data Science, Enterprise Systems, and inclusivity in tech.

📌 For a full and official list, refer to the AAU IS course catalog!

The IS_Talks is a student-led talk series from the School of Information Science at Addis Ababa University, highlighting innovative minds and their journeys. You can watch one of the best episodes featuring Team Roha here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DedNu9pTV3E&t=3187s

Team Roha is made up of 4 Information Systems students — Berhanelidet Bekele, Edeal, Abel, and Shahon — and 1 Computer Science student, Nolawi Assefa. 🎉 Congratulations to Team Roha from Information Systems for securing 2nd place in the Google Developers Club AAU Hackathon! 🏆 Your hard work and dedication have truly paid off, and this achievement is just the beginning. We look forward to seeing even greater accomplishments from you in the future. Keep pushing the boundaries and continue working with the same passion and drive!
😂 Why did the programmer quit his job? Because he didn’t get arrays!
ለምን ፒሲው በጋባ ምርምር አደረገ? የእርሱ ፊውትራ ነበር!
Why don’t programmers like nature? It has too many bugs.
Why was the computer cold? It left its Windows open!
Why do programmers prefer dark mode? Because light attracts bugs!
Why did the computer go to therapy? It had too many bytes of emotional baggage!

patterns: What is the history of the department?
Tell me about the department's history
responses: The Information Science department was established in 2000 to address the growing need for information professionals.

patterns: What is the mission of the department?
What does the department aim to achieve?
responses: The mission of the Information Science department is to educate and train professionals in the field of information management.

patterns: What is the vision of the department?
What does the department aspire to be?
responses: The vision of the Information Science department is to be a leader in information education and research in Africa.

patterns: What are the values of the department?
What does the department believe in?
responses: The Information Science department values integrity, innovation, collaboration, and excellence in education.

patterns: How can I contact the department?
responses: You can reach us at: @TheISSeer or @Berhanbek:

How can I contact the department?
responses:

We host workshops, seminars, and guest lectures throughout the semester. Stay tuned!

patterns: Where can I find more info online?
Is there a website for the department?
responses: You can visit our official website at [www.aau.edu.et](http://www.aau.edu.et) for more information.

patterns: Are there any events in the department?
responses: Yes! We have coding clubs, research groups, hackathons, and seminars every semester.

patterns: Who is the head of the department?
Who leads the Information Science department?
responses: 👨‍🏫 Dr. Michael Melese Woldeyohannis is the current Department Head of the School of Information Science at Addis Ababa University.
The department is led by Dr. Michael Melese. Office: Eshetu Chole 621. Email: michael.melese@aau.edu.et

📆 **Academic Calendar Overview:**
🟢 *1st Semester (October – January)*
- Classes begin early October
- Mid Exams around mid-November
- Final Exams late January

🔵 *2nd Semester (February – June)*
- Classes resume mid-February
- Mid Exams usually in April
- Final Exams early to mid-June

🛎️ *Note:* Dates may shift slightly each year. Always check official announcements or your class advisor!

patterns: Where can I find study materials?
responses: You can find study materials on our Telegram channel @SISResourcesBot or through the department website.
